name: Sani Beach Club

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sani Beach Club at the end of August with our 15 year old Son and 2 girls aged 12 and 10. We had stayed at similar resorts, Pinecliffs in Portugal and Forte Village in Sardinia and had really enjoyed those holidays. After a few years staying in Villas, we decided to return to a Resort holiday thinking that it might offer more options for our children.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful family holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is beautiful. The pool area is lovely, the beach is amazing, the gardens are really well maintained and the view across the resort is just stunning.
reviews.title: Perfect Relaxation

reviews.text: We stayed in a Family Room with sea view and we were really happy with it. The rooms are nicely furnished and the split level gives a spacious feel. The 3rd bed option for my youngest wasnt great, as essentially its a sofa with a sheet over and pillow. A sofa bed would be a more comfortable option for children.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: The restaurant choices are really good. On our arrival, we were met by Vangellis (who really is as amazing as everyone says he is in these reviews!) and fortunately he told us to book the restaurants on our 1st day, as they do get booked very quickly. Whilst we were a little overwhelmed on day 1, trying to understand everything, this was great advice and having looked at the choices before we came, I had an idea of where we wanted to eat. Our favourites were Ouzerie - just the most beautiful setting, Ammos (the best cocktails and superb staff), and the Grill by the pool.
reviews.title: Paradise!
Holiday Perfection!
reviews.text: We opted for Half Board and found the 'DIne Around' allowance worked to a point. The only problem we had was when one night we had a dreadful meal in the Marina at Psaroyannos, a Greek restaurant and the children's food was really poor. On speaking to the Manager, he took the meal off the bill, but this made no difference to us, as we had lost our dine around allowance for that day as you cant carry it forward to the next day. So we didnt really feel that we gained from this.
once again we stayed in this beautiful hotel which for us is more than a hotel.it is home away from home!
reviews.title: perfect as always!

reviews.text: the overall impression is excellent .
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway

reviews.text: we arrived by our own car and at the gates we were greeted by the very polite guard.
reviews.title: This place was a dream,

reviews.text: after we parked our car a club car came and drove us from the scenic routes around the club to the main building where the reception is for check-in.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable family holiday

reviews.text: check-in was very professional and welcoming.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: We have just spent 2 weeks at Sani Beach Club and we are feeling thoroughly relaxed!
reviews.title: Amazeballs!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got off to a bit of a worrying start, when our taxi transfer got a flat tyre and my husband had to help the driver change the spare on a very dangerous road, but guest services Manager Vangelis at Sani Beach Club arranged for this transfer to be complimentary for my husbands efforts! He was amazing and went on to do various other lovely things for us during our stay.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.text: Check in was lovely, we stayed in a Junior suite (522) with private garden and we were given a lift in a club car to our room. The private garden really was a good decision for us as my daughter (who turned 4 during our stay) needed naps after lunch and this gave me and my husband much needed sun/chill time looking out at a beautiful view while my daughter slept on the other side of the patio doors.
reviews.title: Perfect family holiday!

reviews.text: It did take us a few days to settle in and get our head around a few things. The guests are about 75% russian in peak season so hearing russian everywhere took a bit of getting used to. Also, the dine around menu as much as it is a great concept can be a bit of a hassle to book in and organise, but the restaurants are lovely and once you are there you find yourself thinking that you're glad you booked We were full board and do not really drink. I had a total of 6 cocktails and our bill on departure was €800. Not that you go away to worry about money, but it is a significant addition to anyones budget. It's just best to book as many different restaurants in the first few days and go back to the ones you like. Olympus lives up to it's name and the buffet is of a good standard, but you know what you're going to have before you get there.
reviews.title: Memorable holidays!

reviews.text: There were never any issues getting a sun bed. Sani Beach seems to have captured the low key feel perfectly - especially with children. We met e few people that had shuttled over from the Sani Beach Hotel because it was "mental" and could never get a sun bed and were having their things moved. Sani Beach Club never seems to feel like it's crawling with kids, which I think is rarely achieved in a resort during peak season. The kids pool was brilliant and my daughter loved it too.
reviews.title: Relaxed sophistication

reviews.text: This 5 star hotel is fantastic. Good food, greats service and a lovely setting. The "dine around" feature is good but booking essential. The pool is a bit basic, a deep pool unsuitable for small children and a very shallow pool for the youngest, nothing in between.
reviews.title: Great in Greece

reviews.text: The view from the verandah of the dining room is west, into the setting sun. Unbelievable.
reviews.title: The perfect holiday!

reviews.text: Many 5 star hotels in the med don't really get "service" - they do here.
reviews.title: Perfect toddler destination

reviews.text: My wife booked this holiday and due to work-load at the time i didnt pay any attention at all. The hotel is on its own complex and right from the moment you arrive you know youre about to be spoilt. The staff greet you and take you to the main complex building by golf-cart and they take your luggage to your room for you. Cocktails and fresh juices upon arrival and a welcoming befitting royalty. You get given all kinds of information about the million wonderful restaurants and bars available to you, where the mariner is etc, and how frequently their shuttle bus runs around the resort to these places, and it all works brilliantly. You dont need a penny while there as you pay for anything you need with your room key. The food is all exceptional, the accommodation is fantastic, the facilities such as the pool and pool-bar are brilliant too, but the place is made perfect by the people - the staff and management who run the resort. Just off the beach, which is on your door-step, there are a host of water-sports inc a PADI dive-centre, which i highly recommend.
reviews.title: A little bit of paradise

reviews.text: Loved my week in may so much we have booked for two weeks this year. Great hospitality and choice of food in the dine around programme. Upgraded to a sea view room last year but it was on the main entrance way to hotel so was too busy so not bothering to pay extra this year as all rooms appear very nice. Cater for families beautifully and made to feel welcome throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Sani Beach Club at the October half term break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 9 nights in September.
reviews.title: Very nice but not without some issues

reviews.text: On the whole the hotel and the resort are very well done , the staff are great , the hotels and grounds are spotlessly clean, and there are some great features, but there are still a few minuses that prevent me from giving it top marks.
reviews.title: Lovely location but still First Choice style!
Third visit
reviews.text: The Sani resort consists of 4 hotels and the Marina which all but occupy the entire bay ( there is one other hotel / camping area in the bay that is not part of the resort)

The beach Club is separated from the other 3 Resort hotels and the Marina by the non resort hotel , but its only a 5 minute walk along a lovely beach to the Marina.Or alternatively the resort provide a regular shuttle bus which runs between the hotels all day and into the early hours.
reviews.title: FAULTLESS 5* FANTASY!!!

reviews.text: There is lots of free entertainment with shows provided by their mainly English in house entertainment team at the resorts outdoor theatre, there are also smaller musical acts throughout the bars. I would say that the entertainment is very similar in style, and on a par with, some of the best cruises .
reviews.title: Outstanding in every single way!

reviews.text: This was our second visit to sani, we stayed at Porto last time which was amazing as we only had one child and were looking more to cater our own needs.
reviews.title: Fantastic family break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sani beach club is just as exclusive, the added bonus is that our children also enjoyed this wonderful resort. The beaches and sea are very clean, children's club was perfect as was the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Heavan

reviews.text: Staff were fantastic especially periklis from guest services
reviews.title: A first class resort with outstanding client service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived home from the most relaxing and carefree holiday my wife and i have ever experienced. From the moment you arrive the staff cannot do enough for you.The countless bars and restaurants offer you a different choice every day. Would recommend this resort to anyone,
reviews.title: SANI RESORT… THE PERFECT HOTEL

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in September/October for 9 days and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The location and the quality of the service are things that struck us most about Sani Beach club. On arrival you are ferried from the main gate to reception in a golf buggy and given a glass of champagne whilst you complete the check-in process. Our room had a great view of the gardens and the sea and was of a high quality.
reviews.title: Outstanding resort!!!

reviews.text: we are very fortunate living so close to a such marvelous hotel (just an hour drive from thessaloniki) so we have the chance to stay in the club every summer again and again!
reviews.title: happy to be back again!

reviews.text: as always everything was perfect-beautiful appointed room, excellent service, unique surroundings, tasty food, crystal clean sea.
reviews.title: Pearce family - Gloucestershire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: each and everyone of the staff was there all the time with a genuine smile to serve you with the best way.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, fantastic holiday, truly wonderful staff!

reviews.text: special thanks to savas the hotel manager, lia,nikos and marcus in the main restaurant,sokratis,pavel and vagelis in the front desk and not to forget the very kind nikos at the beach service.
reviews.title: Among the best hotels in Europe

reviews.text: daphne and vassilis in the pool bar is our son's favourite persons!
reviews.title: Beautiful sani

reviews.text: As you can probably guess, we came from Australia and visited for 2 weeks with our grandchildren, daughter and son in law. We were blessed with great weather (25-28 each day).
reviews.title: Great Family Destination
Stunning resort - and sets the standard for 5* luxury in European beach resorts
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed the whole of our holiday, the beachs, pool, gym, amenities, marina and restaurants were first class. The choices and quality of food for all ages and races in the main dining room were awesome along with the staff who constantly did more to make things, happy, smooth and a good experience even when tested by a few.
Drinks around the pool in the afternoon were very relaxing!
reviews.title: Our wedding and the best holiday ever!

reviews.text: Service staff were especially good, they could not do enough for you, Natalia, Steffan, Victoria, Nicos, Alban, Areta and George on the beach are some names I fondly remember. The way they mixed with all especially young children was special. Our 3 year old still speaks of them on Skype some 6 weeks later.
reviews.title: top notch

reviews.text: Savas, you train and run a very good team who are happy and keen to assist and help all to enjoy their visit. The kids club was a joy to see operating with the dances for the kids around the pool.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday destination

description: Shimmering azure waters, white sands and ancient olive groves adorning the surrounding hills; it would be hard to dream up a more serene idyll than the Sani Beach Club. The luxuriously welcoming bungalows provide a private setting with stunning views, while a choice of exciting cuisines ensure your stay is very memorable. The intimate surroundings of this luxurious low rise hotel, with magnificent views over Mount Olympus and the Aegean, provide you with a dazzling array of amenities and fun activities, both on and off the water, to bring pleasure to all ages.
